job.title: Software Engineer I
job.description: Position SummaryAs a Software Engineer, you will be a part of a collaborative team that develops with others in Resilience to provide applications and solutions for instruments and analytical software for novel therapeutics. This role will work with stakeholders to develop software-based solutions to manufacturing challenges and develop next-generation therapies and instruments. You will join a dynamic, fast-paced organization and team developing innovative solutions, and you will need to work independently in a collaborative team.Resilience is looking for intelligent, motivated software engineers who enjoy taking on complex challenges, work well in an agile, dynamic environment, and care about high-quality engineering best practices.Job ResponsibilitiesDevelop software (Python, C#) to interface, control, and monitor manufacturing instruments, quality assurance equipment, and visualization tools for analytical analysis.Developing applications that are cloud-focused withGather requirements and generate specifications for software application systems.Contribute to the improvement of our Software Development Life Cycle.Comfortable working in a fast-paced Agile team environmentContribute towards investigation and resolution of technical problemsInnovate at the SW component level and influence decisions in subsystem architecture and design.Contribute towards unit testing, continuous integration, and deployment activitiesQualificationsStrong knowledge of programming with C#, Java, or other object-oriented languagesStrong understanding of scripting languages, including Python and bashUnderstanding of object-oriented analysis and designProven ability to self-manage and have an ability to deal well with ambiguity and work independently and as a multidisciplinary analytical research team member in a fast-paced environment.Background knowledge in computational biology, immunology, wet-lab experimental procedures, and data analysis is a plus.Preferred ExperienceBSc/MS: 1-2 years of experience or Ph.D. in a scientific-analytical field, e.g., computer science, bioinformatics, data science, or neurology.Experience with source control management repositories (such as GIT, SVN, etc.) and Configuration ManagementKnowledge and experience with cloud application development
